qas.question: What allows unhindered light and thermal radiation?

qas.question: What is caused by the atmospheres in-stability?

qas.question: What is strongest over the western desert?
What part of the Sahara is the most rainless part of the planet?
What prevents light and thermal radiation?

plausible_answers.text: The stability of the atmosphere above the desert prevents any convective overturning

qas.question: Why is there a minimal risk of sunny, dry, or stable weather?
Where was the Koppen climate classification created?
What is strongest over the northern part of the Great Desert?
What desert, located in Chile, is the sunniest, driest, and most rainless place on the planet?

context: <b8_0>The permanent <a0_0>dissolution of <b3_0>clouds<b8_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> allows unhindered light and thermal radiation. <b9_0>The stability of the atmosphere above the desert prevents any convective overturning<b9_0/>, thus <b4_0>making <a1_0>rainfall<a1_0/> virtually non-existent<b4_0/>. As a consequence, the weather tends to be sunny, dry and stable with a minimal risk of rainfall. Subsiding, diverging, dry air masses associated with <b5_0>subtropical high-pressure systems<b5_0/> are extremely unfavorable for the development of convectional showers. The subtropical ridge is the predominate factor that explains the hot desert climate (Köppen climate classification BWh) of this vast region. <b11_0>The lowering of <b6_0>air<b11_0/> is the strongest and the most effective<b6_0/> over the <a2_0>eastern part of the Great Desert<a2_0/>, in <b12_0>the <b7_0>Libyan Desert<b12_0/><b7_0/> which is the sunniest, the driest and the most nearly rainless place on the planet rivaling the Atacama Desert, lying in <b10_0>Chile<b10_0/> and Peru.
